riskAssessmentMethodology.methodology: Risk is assessed using ISO21434 methodology combining attack feasibility and impact severity

risks.title: Unauthorized Device Pairing Risk
risks.description: Risk of attackers gaining unauthorized access to vehicle systems through exploitation of Bluetooth pairing vulnerabilities

safety.description: Potential for distractions or improper system operation through unauthorized commands

financial.description: Costs associated with addressing vulnerability and potential warranty claims

operational.description: Disruption to normal operation of infotainment and connected systems

privacy.description: Unauthorized access to personal contact information, call logs, and other private data

regulatory.description: Potential violation of data protection regulations (e.g., GDPR) due to unauthorized data access

reputational.description: Significant brand damage from publicized security breach of vehicle systems

attackVector.description: Requires physical proximity but no direct physical access needed

attackComplexity.description: Particularly if 'Just Works' pairing is enabled, attack complexity is reduced

privilegesRequired.description: No existing privileges required to initiate attack

userInteraction.description: Vehicle user must initiate or respond to pairing process

riskRating.justification: The combination of Medium feasibility and High impact results in High risk according to the risk matrix. The privacy and regulatory impacts are particularly significant.

risks.title: Bluetooth Communication Eavesdropping Risk
risks.description: Risk of sensitive information being exposed through interception of Bluetooth communications

safety.description: Limited direct safety impact from information disclosure

financial.description: Costs associated with addressing vulnerability and potential legal liabilities

operational.description: Minimal impact on system operations as attack is passive

privacy.description: Severe privacy violation from exposure of calls, contacts, and personal data

regulatory.description: Clear violations of data protection regulations resulting in potential penalties

reputational.description: Significant public trust erosion if personal conversations are compromised

attackVector.description: Requires physical proximity to the vehicle during communications

attackComplexity.description: Requires specialized equipment and technical expertise to intercept and decrypt communications

privilegesRequired.description: No existing privileges required to attempt interception

userInteraction.description: Attack can be carried out without any user interaction

riskRating.justification: The combination of Medium feasibility and High impact results in High risk according to the matrix, but the high attack complexity provides some natural mitigation, warranting a Medium final rating.

risks.title: Bluetooth Denial of Service Risk
risks.description: Risk of vehicle Bluetooth connectivity being disrupted through jamming or resource exhaustion

safety.description: Potential minor distraction if connectivity is lost during critical operation

financial.description: Limited financial impact beyond customer support costs

operational.description: Disruption to normal operation of Bluetooth-dependent features

privacy.description: No direct privacy impact from denial of service

reputational.description: Negative customer experience resulting in dissatisfaction

attackVector.description: Requires physical proximity to target vehicle

attackComplexity.description: Basic RF jamming requires minimal technical expertise and commonly available equipment

userInteraction.description: Attack can be carried out without any user interaction

riskRating.justification: The combination of High feasibility and Medium impact results in High risk according to the matrix, but the limited overall damage potential justifies a Medium final rating.

riskTreatmentOptions.description: Implementation of additional controls to reduce risk to acceptable level
Transfer of risk to another party (e.g., through insurance or warranties)
Elimination of risk by removing the vulnerable feature or functionality
Formal acceptance of risk with justification and monitoring

riskTreatmentPlans.justification: Risk can be significantly reduced through improved pairing security measures

proposedControls.title: Enhanced Pairing Security
proposedControls.description: Implement Secure Connections Only mode and require user confirmation for all pairings
proposedControls.implementation: Software update to Bluetooth controller firmware

proposedControls.title: Pairing Attempt Rate Limiting
proposedControls.description: Implement controls to prevent brute force attacks by limiting unsuccessful pairing attempts
proposedControls.implementation: Software update to Bluetooth controller firmware

proposedControls.title: Pairing Authentication Enhancement
proposedControls.description: Implement multi-factor authentication for Bluetooth pairing
proposedControls.implementation: Software update to IVI system and Bluetooth controller

residualRisk.justification: Implementation of proposed controls would significantly decrease attack feasibility by addressing key vulnerabilities in the pairing process

riskTreatmentPlans.justification: Risk can be reduced by strengthening encryption and implementing additional data protection

proposedControls.title: Enhanced Bluetooth Encryption
proposedControls.description: Upgrade to strongest available Bluetooth encryption standards and refuse connections with devices supporting only legacy encryption
proposedControls.implementation: Software update to Bluetooth controller firmware

proposedControls.title: Application-Level Encryption
proposedControls.description: Implement additional end-to-end encryption for sensitive data on top of Bluetooth standard encryption
proposedControls.implementation: Software update to IVI system applications

proposedControls.title: Sensitive Data Classification
proposedControls.description: Classify and limit data transmitted over Bluetooth according to sensitivity

residualRisk.justification: Additional encryption layers and data protection would significantly reduce the impact of potential eavesdropping attacks

riskTreatmentPlans.justification: Risk can be mitigated through improved resilience measures and monitoring

proposedControls.title: Advanced Frequency Hopping
proposedControls.description: Implement enhanced adaptive frequency hopping to better avoid interference
proposedControls.implementation: Software update to Bluetooth controller firmware

proposedControls.title: Connection Request Throttling
proposedControls.description: Implement controls to limit connection requests from unknown devices
proposedControls.implementation: Software update to Bluetooth controller firmware

proposedControls.title: Bluetooth Interface Monitoring
proposedControls.description: Implement monitoring to detect and respond to potential jamming or DoS attacks
proposedControls.implementation: Software update to Bluetooth controller and IVI system

residualRisk.justification: While impossible to completely prevent physical jamming, improved resilience and detection measures would reduce impact and duration of DoS attacks

criteria.requirementsForAcceptance: Formal risk assessment, documented controls, and monitoring plan
Detailed risk assessment, comprehensive treatment plan, board notification

relatedRequirements.description: The Bluetooth system shall implement secure pairing mechanisms with minimum PIN length of 6 digits
The Bluetooth system shall use AES-128 minimum encryption for all communications
The Bluetooth system shall implement rate limiting for connection attempts
The Bluetooth system shall require explicit user confirmation for all device pairings
The Bluetooth system shall implement additional application-level encryption for sensitive data

keyTerms.Risk Assessment: Process of identifying, analyzing and evaluating risk
keyTerms.Attack Feasibility: Likelihood that an attack can be successfully carried out

contentSummary: This document provides a comprehensive risk assessment for the Bluetooth Connectivity system based on previously identified threat and damage scenarios. Three primary risks are evaluated: Unauthorized Device Pairing (High risk), Bluetooth Communication Eavesdropping (Medium risk), and Bluetooth Denial of Service (Medium risk). Each risk is analyzed according to ISO21434 methodology, combining attack feasibility and impact severity across multiple dimensions including safety, financial, operational, privacy, regulatory and reputational impacts. The assessment reveals that privacy and regulatory impacts are most significant for unauthorized access and eavesdropping risks, while operational impacts dominate for denial of service risks. The document details risk treatment strategies with proposed controls for each risk, including enhanced pairing security, additional encryption layers, and improved resilience measures. Implementation of these controls is expected to reduce all identified risks to a low residual level.
